Description: Blue and White glazed pottery dish; Chinoiserie floral design divided into 6 sections in the well of the dish, interlace pattern in the cavetto with cartouches. One of these has individual letters possibly Persian.
Curator's comments: The production centre is as yet unclear. It could be Mamluk ca 15th century or Persian of the same date. The individual letters whose significance is not evident appear to be written in Persian style of script.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Axia Art Islamique et Byzantin
